website_summaries.verdict: The winter hiking boot from Danner impressed outdoor enthusiasts by delivering comfort and warmth in a lightweight package. Its effective waterproofing and grippy outsole wowed consumers and critics alike. On the other hand, some might get turned off by the gear’s faulty seam construction. All in all, the Danner Mountain 600 Weatherized remains to be a good choice for winter hiking if insulation and comfort are the top requirements for potential buyers.
pros: Droves of buyers said that the Danner Mountain 600 Weatherized was comfortable
This winter hiker received top marks from the majority for its effective thermal insulation
It required virtually zero break-in time, as testified by a handful of users
A critic praised this boot for delivering sufficient traction on slippery ground
Its waterproof liner was successful in keeping a reviewer’s foot dry
Some consumers applauded the footgear’s lightness
cons: A few Danner Mountain 600 Weatherized owners were disappointed when the upper’s seams started coming apart after a few uses

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Winter Boot
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these boots after a few days. Haven’t used them for hiking yet, but as a general winter boot alternative to my Sorels, these are surprisingly good. Excellent grip, small profile makes them easy to drive in, good ankle support, and kept my feet warm in 0F Wisconsin winter weather while shoveling this weekend. I typically wear a 9.5 and that’s what Danner recommended. I find these are maybe 1/4 size too large, but are almost perfect with thick wool socks, which I’ll almost always wear with these boots. 9 was too small.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Walter

customer_reviews.title: Danner Mountain 600 Insulated
customer_reviews.text: Decide I wanted the insulated for winter in New England. Was worried that the color would be too dark but it is not. Fit is spot on to my size. The Leather is soft and not stiff. Really nice fitting comfortable out of the box. Probably very little break in. Another solid boot by Danner.
customer_reviews.author: rugby49

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough for me
customer_reviews.text: I guess I have extra wide feet because the wide version isn’t wide enough for me. Otherwise is seems like a well made boot.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Crane

customer_reviews.title: Good light weight hiking boot with a bit of warmth
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a boot for day hikes & dog walking in the colder months that would be lighter weight than my more serious backpacking boots, this pair fit the bill. I haven't had it that long but it was comfortable out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: Be certain to buy Danner Dxt Footbed Liners. They make the difference at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Realph

customer_reviews.title: Correct fit
customer_reviews.text: Finally a pair of boots that don’t hurt and fit the way they should. I’ll let you know how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Tay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable.... I am happy with my purchase.. I have only had these boots for one day.... I will update my review when I have had them a bit longer..
customer_reviews.author: Love Phones

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and well made
customer_reviews.text: I plan to hike to the top of Mt. Adams in WA.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I hope my issue is a one-off incident. Just received my boots and the left boot lace is frayed/shredding and the left boot itself shows signs of being scratched/damaged. Unfortunately I will just have to deal with scratched/damaged exterior and will have to order replacement laces as it seems my size is no longer available for an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: He really likes them. Said they fit as expected and are comfortable. You do have to wear taller socks otherwise they'll get pulled down. The insulation is great and he can't wait for winter. Only complaint is they don't have a locking system for the laces but other than that they're great.
customer_reviews.author: A. Boeke

customer_reviews.title: Awesome walking/hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically for walking outdoors in the MN winter. I have had the good fortune of trying them out both on relative dry conditions, as well as ice and snow. They are extremely comfortable, and very warm. They seemed a little heavy out of the box, but once they are on your feet you do not notice. I rarely take the time to write reviews - but I have been so impressed with these Danner's, I felt compelled to.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Randall

customer_reviews.title: Good waterproof boot
customer_reviews.text: Fit good. Truly waterproof boot. I’m satisfied with them. I love Danners
customer_reviews.author: Joe Ferraro

customer_reviews.title: These Danners are not made in the US
customer_reviews.text: I have the winterized version and am a bit suprised to see such a thin layer of PrimaLoft - one can barely tell if this is an insulated boot or not. So far so good though testing them outdoors in 23F weather. Very light weight and stylish. Just dissappointed that these are not from Oregon like many of the other mountain series boots they make. Great looking colors and design except for the 1990s 'waves' design at the sides of the sole. Really? Looks cheap. Don't pay retail for these - look for discounts or sales as they do not command the made in America price.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Brown

product_meta.title: Danner Men's Mountain 600 4.5" 200g Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Inspired by decades of legendary hiking boots, we partnered with Vibram to forge a new path in hiking footwear. The combination of the Vibram spe midsole and fuga outsole gives an unparalleled grip on wet and dry surfaces while providing superior cushioning without the weight. Designed to withstand the climate and terrain of the pacific northwest, we utilized a rugged, waterproof suede upper and Danner dry waterproof protection. The mountain 600 defines a new category in hiking boots we call performance heritage - combining our classic styling with lightweight innovation.
feature_bullets: Premium full-grain leather upper with 200G PrimaLoft insulation
Vibram Fuga outsole with Megagrip technology offers superior grip on wet and dry surfaces.
Vibram SPE midsole for maximum rebound, comfort and support.
